casebody.data:
DICKSON, et al
v.
RUCHO, et al 201PA12-5 Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 20, 2018 Phillip J. Strach, Attorney at Law, Michael D. McKnight, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Rucho, Robert et al. Edwin Speas, Attorney at Law, Caroline P. Mackie, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Anita S. Earls, Attorney at Law, for Dickson, Margaret, et al.

Thomas A. Farr, Attorney at law, Raleigh.

Alexander McC. Peters, Senior Deputy Attorney General, James Bernier, Jr., Special Deputy Attorney General, for State of North Carolina, et al.

Susan K. Nichols, Special Deputy Attorney General.

John W. O'Hale, Guardian ad Litem.

Allison J. Riggs, Attorney at Law, Adam Stein, Attorney at Law, Chapel Hill, Victor Goode, Attorney at Law, John F. Carella, Staff Attorney, for North Carolina State Conference Of Branches Of The NAACP, et al.

Clare Barnett, Attorney at Law.

John A. Bussian, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for NC Press Association, Inc., et al. Mark J. Prak, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for N.C. Association of Broadcasters, Inc.

Charles E. Coble, Attorney at Law, Raleigh.

Dorrian H. Horsey, Attorney at Law.

Hugh Stevens, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Open Government Coalition, Inc. Geraldine Sumter, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Kareem Crayton, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Terry Smith, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for N.C. Legislative Black Caucus. David Lambeth, for David Lambeth. Mark A. Finkelstein, Attorney at Law, Matthew Nis Leerberg, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Jessica Ring Amunson, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Leah J. Tulin, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Michelle R. Singer, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Election Law Professors. H. Jefferson Powell, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Law Professors. Meghann K. Burke, Attorney at Law, Michael E. Casterline, Attorney at Law, Asheville, Theodore V. Wells, Jr., Attorney at Law, Robert A. Atkins, Attorney at Law, Jaren Janghorbani, Attorney at Law, Farrah R. Berse, Attorney at Law, Pietro Signoracci, Attorney at Law, for Congressional Black Caucus. Jaclyn Maffetore, Attorney at Law, Irving Joyner, Attorney at Law, Durham, for North Carolina State Conference Of Branches Of The NAACP, et al.

*293The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 11th of May 2018 by Plaintiffs:

"Motion Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 20th of September 2018."
